<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of cleanup_upgraded_connection:
```c
static void
cleanup_upgraded_connection (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  struct MHD_UpgradeResponseHandle *urh = connection->urh;

  if (NULL == urh)
    return;
#ifdef HTTPS_SUPPORT
  /* Signal remote client the end of TLS connection by
   * gracefully closing TLS session. */
  if (0 != (connection->daemon->options & MHD_USE_TLS))
    gnutls_bye (connection->tls_session,
                GNUTLS_SHUT_WR);

  if (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET != urh->mhd.socket)
    MHD_socket_close_chk_ (urh->mhd.socket);

  if (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET != urh->app.socket)
    MHD_socket_close_chk_ (urh->app.socket);
#endif /* HTTPS_SUPPORT */
  connection->urh = NULL;
  free (urh);
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  if (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET != urh->app.socket)
    MHD_socket_close_chk_ (urh->app.socket);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown fragment: cleanup_upgraded_connection does not call itself; it calls a different function MHD_socket_close_chk_. Rule 17.2 would be violated only if MHD_socket_close_chk_ (or a chain of functions it calls) invoked cleanup_upgraded_connection, creating indirect recursion. There is no evidence of that in the provided code — inspect the implementation of MHD_socket_close_chk_ (and its callees) to be sure no indirect call to cleanup_upgraded_connection exists.
